synth.name: Drumbrute Impact

steps: Press <synth-button>⏹️</synth-button> quickly three times in a row
Press <synth-button>Copy</synth-button>
Press the pad of the instrument to copy from
Optionally, press <synth-button>Bank</synth-button> and then a target bank
Optionally, press <synth-button>Pattern</synth-button> and then a target pattern
Press the pad of the instrument to copy to
Select the pattern to copy from
Press <synth-button>Copy</synth-button>
Press the step for the pattern to copy to
Select the pattern
Hold <synth-button>Last Step</synth-button>, then press <synth-button>»</synth-button> to select the 16-step portion of the 64-step pattern
Press step button 1–16 to set the last step of that 16-step portion
Select the pattern
Hold <synth-button>Shift</synth-button> and press <synth-button>»</synth-button>
Tap <synth-button>Mute</synth-button>
Tap the instrument/part to mute or unmute
Tapping <synth-button>Mute</synth-button> again will unmute everything
Tapping <synth-button>Mute</synth-button> again re-mute what was muted previously
Hold <synth-button>Shift</synth-button> and tap <synth-button>Mute</synth-button> to clear all solo'ed instruments from the group
Mute Instruments / Parts.notes: This is the behavior when in Toggle mode, which is set in MIDI Control Center

steps: Hold <synth-button>Shift</synth-button> and tap <synth-button>16</synth-button> to enable Polyrhythms for the pattern (if needed)
Tap one of the pads to configure its pattern length
Tap <synth-button>Step</synth-button> to enter step edit mode
Hold <synth-button>Last Step</synth-button> and tap one of the buttons 1–16 to set the last step for that instrument
Tap the instrument/part to edit (button 1–6)
Tap <synth-button>Current Track</synth-button>, next to the <synth-knob>Random</synth-knob> knob.
Adjust <synth-knob>Random</synth-knob> to add random behavior to that track.
If lit, tap <synth-button>Current Track</synth-button>, next to the <synth-knob>Random</synth-knob> knob so that it's unlit.
Adjust <synth-knob>Random</synth-knob> to add random behavior to the pattern.
Tap the instrument to edit
Hold down a step button 1–16

Tap the Roller to set the repeat:
  • 1⁄4 for 1 trigger
  • 1⁄8 for 2 triggers
  • 1⁄16 for 3 triggers
  • 1⁄32 for 4 triggers
Ratchet or Flam Steps.notes: When holding down the step, the light above the Roller indicates the current state

steps: Press <synth-button>▶️</synth-button> to start playback
Hold Shift and tap 9 so that the button is lit
Hold down one of the four buttons in the Touch Strip
Tap and hold an instrument button to roll that instrument
Roll Instrument (Roller).notes: The frequency of the roll depends upon where on the Touch Strip you are touching

steps: Tap <synth-button>Solo</synth-button>
Tap the instrument/part to solo or remove from solo group
Tapping <synth-button>Solo</synth-button> again will unmute everything
Tapping <synth-button>Solo</synth-button> again re-solo what was solo'ed previously
Hold <synth-button>Shift</synth-button> and tap <synth-button>Solo</synth-button> to clear all solo'ed instruments from the group
Solo Instruments / Parts.notes: This is the behavior when in Toggle mode, which is set in MIDI Control Center

steps: Press <synth-button>▶️</synth-button> to start playback
Hold Shift and tap 9 so that the button is unlit
Hold down one of the four buttons in the Touch Strip
Tap and hold a step button to repeat the pattern from that step
Step Repeat (Looper).notes: The length of the repeat depends upon where on the Touch Strip you are touching

steps: Select the pattern to modify
Hold <synth-button>Shift</synth-button> and tap 1–5 to change the timing of steps. Refer to the blue labels

notes: You must hit <synth-button>Sync</synth-button> to select MIDI if using MIDI. Every. Single. Time.
The “Auto Sync” feature available in MIDI control center doesn't exactly work. It reverts the Drumbrute to the internal clock often and creates an unreliable situation
Closed HH will choke Open HH
When cable is plugged into individual out, it's removed from the main out and headphones out
Distortion only applies to instruments sent into Main out, not anything on individual outs
Before using MCC to change things, import your patterns or they will be lost when you update the Drumbrute Impact

midi.notes: MIDI Channel must be changed in MIDI Control Center
